alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 17 at 4:43PM MST until January 19 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to noon MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snowfall will be the heaviest Wednesday evening through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
